snp5.19:1.1: To anugāyati is to keep on reciting, as the brahmins did with their hymns descended from seers of old (as eg. AN 5.192:3.1).
snp5.19:8.1: This verse and the next were apparently spoken by Bāvarī.
snp5.19:16.1: This verse is apparently spoken by the Buddha.
snp5.19:18.1: That adhideva means “about the gods” is established at MN 90:17.8.
